SEARCH
Package org.example.model.chaosgame

Class JuliaSetGame

java.lang.Object
org.example.model.chaosgame.JuliaSetGame
public class JuliaSetGame extends Object

JuliaSetGame.

The JuliaSetGame class is used to generate a Julia set set based on a description and a canvas.

The Julia set game extends the Game class, and is used to calculate the value of each pixel in the canvas based on the Julia set values

The run method is inspired by the pseudocode from wikipedia.org/Julia_set

Since:
0.4.0
Version:
1.0.0

  • Constructor Details

    • JuliaSetGame

      public JuliaSetGame(ChaosGameDescription description, int width, int height, int maxIterations, double escapeRadius)
      Constructor for Julia set game, creates an object with the given description, width, height, max iterations and escape radius.
      Parameters:
      description - the description to use
      width - the width to use
      height - the height to use
      maxIterations - the maximum number of iterations
      escapeRadius - the escape radius
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given width or height is not positive, or if the given description is null

  • Method Details

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(ChaosGameDescription description)
      Sets the description of the Julia set.
      Parameters:
      description - the description to set
      Throws:

    • runSteps

      public void runSteps(int maxIterations)
      Runs the julia set for each pixel.
      Parameters:
      maxIterations - the maximum number of iterations to run per pixel
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given max iterations is not positive

      public void calculatePoint(int x0, int x1, double cx, double cy)
      Calculates the value of the pixel at the given point, and sets it on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      x0 - the x-coordinate of the point
      x1 - the y-coordinate of the point
      cx - the x-coordinate of the complex number
      cy - the y-coordinate of the complex number

      IllegalArgumentException - if the given steps is less than or equal to zero
